item.title: Life Update: Scholarship Paperwork, 3D Art & Getting Ready for Ramadan
item.description:
Intro

This week, I know exactly what I want to talk about… HEHEHEHE! ğŸ˜†

The reason behind that? Well, I couldnâ€™t do anything about AI Testing as planned.

But no worries! Life doesnâ€™t always go as I want, so I just had to go with the flow. Meow ğŸ±

Hereâ€™s Why!

I had to finish the paperwork for a Korean Scholarshipâ€”it was a lot! Four sets of documents, to be exact.

Then, I helped prepare gifts for my lovely dadâ€™s friends. He wanted to gift them dates and Zamzam water so they could break their fast during Ramadan, which starts on Sunday, March 2nd. I truly enjoyed the process of preparing these gifts. ğŸâœ¨

On top of that, I started creating a 3D model based on one of my old 2D drawings! This is the first time Iâ€™m creating something from scratch without following a tutorial. Itâ€™s making me realize that I can do itâ€”thereâ€™s no need to be afraid!

Of course, I still forget things like hotkeys, but thankfully, Blenderâ€™s guide and past tutorials are really helping me, especially with texturing and render settings.

Other than that…

Ramadan is starting tomorrow, and thanks to my mindful family, weâ€™ve already agreed to keep things simple. No unnecessary stress, especially when it comes to food!

Our rule? Keep it minimal. Just two samosas each and soup is a must! ğŸ²

Conclusion

I promised myself that Iâ€™d post a blog every week, so here I am keeping that promise.

This was just a brief update about my weekâ€”so remember, just take it easy! ğŸ˜Š
